## Description

<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of your changes -->

## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change that fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change that adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Test improvement

## Testing

### Test Coverage

- [ ] Unit tests added/updated
- [ ] Component tests added/updated
- [ ] E2E tests added/updated
- [ ] All tests passing
- [ ] Coverage meets 90% threshold

### Manual Testing

<!-- Describe how you manually tested your changes -->

## Code Quality Checklist

### Coding Standards

- [ ] Follows kebab-case naming conventions
- [ ] Uses Composition API (standard `<script>`)
- [ ] Single quotes and semicolons used
- [ ] Max line length 120 characters
- [ ] Imports properly organized
- [ ] No ESLint errors or warnings
- [ ] Code formatted with Prettier
- [ ] TypeScript strict mode passes

### SOLID Principles

- [ ] Single Responsibility - Each component/function has one purpose
- [ ] Open/Closed - Code is extensible without modification
- [ ] Liskov Substitution - Proper interfaces and contracts
- [ ] Interface Segregation - Small, focused composables
- [ ] Dependency Inversion - Depends on abstractions

### Documentation

- [ ] JSDoc comments added for all exported functions
- [ ] Component props documented
- [ ] Complex logic explained with comments
- [ ] README updated (if needed)
- [ ] Documentation files updated (if needed)

### Error Handling

- [ ] Comprehensive error handling added
- [ ] Edge cases covered
- [ ] User-friendly error messages
- [ ] Errors logged appropriately

## Performance Impact

<!-- Describe any performance implications -->

- [ ] No performance degradation
- [ ] Performance improved
- [ ] Performance impact acceptable (explain below)

## Deployment Notes

## Checklist Before Merge

- [ ] Code reviewed by at least one team member
- [ ] All CI/CD checks passing
- [ ] Branch is up to date with main
- [ ] Commit messages follow Conventional Commits
- [ ] No commented-out code
- [ ] No console.log statements
- [ ] No TODO comments (create issues instead)

## Reviewer Notes

<!-- Any specific areas you want reviewers to focus on -->

---

**For Reviewers:**

Please check:
1. Code follows all coding standards
2. SOLID principles are respected
3. Tests are comprehensive
4. Documentation is complete
5. Error handling is robust
6. No security concerns
7. Performance is acceptable
